Comment: Somewhere in chess heaven, Horatio Caro smiled.
The usual development of the B.
Locking in his strong point at Q4.
Defending the base of his Pawn chain.
Strengthening the QP and setting a trap.
Offering Adams a way out if he's willing to exchange Queens.
Adams' greed gets the better of him.
After 10 Q-R5 P-QN3, Adams' Q would fall... so he resigns at once.
